div.p: Rather than the candidate just being there to earn the money and go I would always employ somebody who had a specific
interest in that job and also I’d also employ the one who had the best... how do I put that... the best I was going to say moral values
but that’s not right, but the best... I suppose it’s an old fashioned term of respect and values rather than I think a person who just turns up,
earns the money and goes home. In my personal view qualifications are probably great to have and if you’ve got them it probably
opens the door to get an interview or something but I don’t see them as being the be-all and end-all of employing that person.
